TITLE: N.J. woman gets 3 years in bogus good Samaritan online fundraiser
SUMMARY: Katelyn McClure helped her boyfriend spread a feel-good story about a homeless veteran, garnering more than $400,000 in GoFundMe donations. She is also serving a one-year federal term.

SUMMARY: Supporters of far-right former President Jair Bolsonaro, who are calling on the military to take control of the country, broke into three government buildings in Brazil's capital on Sunday.

SUMMARY: Kalb, a former correspondent for <em>The New York Times

SUMMARY: Brazil's far-right ex-president was lying low in Orlando, Fla., as a mob of his supporters stormed government buildings this weekend. Analysts say the move insulates him from possible legal jeopardy.

SUMMARY: President Biden approved an emergency declaration as parts of California issue evacuation orders and close school districts after intense downpours.

SUMMARY: Georgia, ranked No. 1, stopped Texas Christian's vaunted offense and ended their improbable season. The Bulldogs are the first team to repeat as champion in the college football playoff era.

SUMMARY: The unnamed assailant is seriously injured after being shot in the chest. He used "a bladed weapon" during the attack at the French capital's busy Gare du Nord train station Wednesday morning.

SUMMARY: Jennifer Homendy, the head of the National Transportation Safety Board, expressed concern about the safety risks that heavy electric vehicles pose if they collide with lighter vehicles.

SUMMARY: Artist and author Deena Mohamed created a graphic novel about how wishes would â or wouldn't â work in modern-day Egypt. Her much-praised book is now out in English. It's ... a wish come true!

TITLE: China's authorities are quietly rounding up people who protested against COVID rules

SUMMARY: Protests against Peruvian President Dina Boluarte's government that have left dozens of people dead since they began a month ago spread through the south of the Andean country.

SUMMARY: Musk has lost hundreds of billions of dollars in recent years, largely due to Tesla stock plummeting.

SUMMARY: Visiting Saudi Arabia last summer, President Biden tried to reassure Arab leaders of U.S. commitment to the region's security. But Gulf nations aren't necessarily rushing to side with Washington.

TITLE: Bank of America says problem with Zelle transactions is resolved
SUMMARY: The website Downdetector reported spikes in outages involving Bank of America and payment platform Zelle starting Wednesday morning.

TITLE: Funerals begin for dozens of people killed in an attack on a Dnipro apartment complex

TITLE: Bank of America says the problem with Zelle transactions is resolved
SUMMARY: The website Downdetector reported spikes in outages involving Bank of America and payment platform Zelle starting Wednesday morning.

TITLE: 'A Room With a View' actor Julian Sands is missing after he went on a hike

TITLE: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern plans to leave office
SUMMARY: Speaking to her party's annual caucus, 42-year-old Ardern said "it's time" for her to move on and that she "no longer had enough in the tank" for her premiership.

SUMMARY: Prosecutors made the announcement as work was set to resume on <em>Rust,

SUMMARY: In an accident similar to Alec Baldwin's shooting of Halyna Hutchins, Lee's co-star fired a prop gun at the 28-year-old actor during filming of <em>The Crow

SUMMARY: Grady Hendrix's tale of siblings who come together after the deaths of their parents to sell their house fully embraces all the elements readers have come to love about Hendrix's storytelling.

SUMMARY: Western defense officials are meeting to coordinate military assistance to Ukraine. Germany has resisted their efforts to persuade the country to export its Leopard 2 tanks, or allow others to do so.

TITLE: Who's most likely to save us from the next pandemic? The answer may surprise you
SUMMARY: The South African-based scientist who co-discovered the omicron variant of COVID-19 makes an intriguing argument.

TITLE: Sarah Huckabee Sanders will give the Republican response to the State of the Union
SUMMARY: Sanders was elected the governor of Arkansas in November. But she is not new to politics. She served as press secretary to President Trump and is the daughter of former Arkansas Gov. Mike Huckabee.

TITLE: House Republicans vote to remove Rep. Ilhan Omar from the Foreign Affairs Committee
SUMMARY: Republicans have cited the Minnesota Democrat's past controversial comments about Israel. Omar, who herself has faced anti-Muslim bigotry since taking office, called the move "purely partisan."

TITLE: BeyoncÃ©'s Renaissance tour is Ticketmaster's next big test. Fans are already stressed
SUMMARY: The first round of tickets to BeyoncÃ©'s highly anticipated Renaissance world tour go on sale next week. Ticketmaster is under pressure to avoid a repeat of the Taylor Swift debacle in November.

TITLE: Gunmen destroy 800 ballot boxes in Nigeria, the latest in a series of attacks
SUMMARY: Insecurity is a huge issue in Nigeria, with a militant Islamist insurgency in the north east, banditry in the north west and a rise in kidnapping for cash countrywide.

TITLE: Tate Modern's terrace is a nuisance for wealthy neighbors, top U.K. court rules
SUMMARY: For years, tourists have peered into multi-million-dollar apartments from the top of London's busiest art gallery. Britain's Supreme Court says that has to change.

TITLE: 'Who the hell would want this job?' Not NCAA president Mark Emmert, apparently
SUMMARY: NCAA president Mark Emmert is stepping down from his position amid a turbulent time for the organization.

TITLE: Amazon reports its first unprofitable year since 2014
SUMMARY: The biggest culprit was Amazon hefty investment in the electric automaker Rivian, whose value plummeted last year. Amazon also contends with the need to recalibrate after a pandemic-era upsurge.

TITLE: Pentagon says a suspected Chinese spy balloon has been spotted over the Western U.S.
SUMMARY: The balloon has been spotted over U.S. airspace for a couple days, The Pentagon decided not to shoot it down due to risks of harm for people on the ground, officials said.

TITLE: Texas ice storm leaves hundreds of thousands without power
SUMMARY: Nearly 350,000 customers in the state were without power on Thursday afternoon. And one major utility service in the state said it did not know when it would be able to restore power.

TITLE: In India, couples begin their legal battle for same-sex marriage
SUMMARY: Couples have filed petitions to India's Supreme Court seeking the legalization of same-sex marriage. The decision could make India the second economy in Asia after Taiwan to recognize the unions.

TITLE: Manufacturer recalls eye drops after possible link to bacterial infections
SUMMARY: EzriCare artificial tears are suspected to be the cause of an outbreak of the VIM-GES-CRPA strain of Pseudomonas aeruginosa, which the CDC said is the first outbreak of its kind in the U.S.

TITLE: Yale honors the work of a 9-year-old Black girl whose neighbor reported her to police
SUMMARY: Bobbi Wilson went on a mission to save New Jersey's trees, capturing spotted lanternflies. That frightened her neighbor, who called the cops. Now, her bug collection is part of a Yale museum.

TITLE: Climate change and a population boom could dry up the Great Salt Lake in 5 years
SUMMARY: Utah leaders are under pressure to end water diversions and enforce tougher restrictions in order save the drying Great Salt Lake. A recent report predicted it will completely dry in five years.

TITLE: Brandon Tsay wants to use his celebrity to help heal his community
SUMMARY: The 26-year-old, who wrested the gun from a shooter who killed 11 people, has been hailed as a hero. Now, he's using his platform to redirect the overwhelming support to Asian American communities.

TITLE: In many parts of the northern U.S., it's really cold. Here's how to stay safe
SUMMARY: Windchill warnings and advisories are in parts of the northern United States as regions see temperatures settle in the single digits.

TITLE: China says it is looking into the report of a spy balloon over U.S. airspace
SUMMARY: The balloon has been spotted over U.S. airspace for a couple days, The Pentagon decided not to shoot it down due to risks of harm for people on the ground, officials said.

TITLE: Europe is set to ban Russian oil products, the latest strike on the Kremlin war chest
SUMMARY: Starting Sunday, the EU will prohibit imports of Russian gasoline, diesel and other products from Russian refineries used throughout Europe.

TITLE: European leaders meet in Kyiv to discuss Ukraine's path toward joining the EU
SUMMARY: This is the first summit to take place with Ukraine as an official candidate to join the European Union

TITLE: China says the balloon is theirs but not used for spying. Here's what we know
SUMMARY: China's foreign ministry described the balloon as "a civilian airship" used for meteorological research that had blown far off course by winds. The Pentagon suspects it's collecting information.

TITLE: Pope Francis arrives in South Sudan in hopes he can revive the peace process
SUMMARY: While there is excitement, the trip comes with a sense of urgency. Despite a peace deal, violence along political and ethnic lines has continued and millions are in the grip of famine.

TITLE: U.S. employers added 517,000 jobs last month. It's a surprisingly strong number
SUMMARY: U.S. employers added 517,000 jobs in January, as the unemployment rate fell to 3.4% . The job market remains tight, despite signs of a slowing economy.

TITLE: Blinken postpones his China trip after a Chinese balloon is spotted over Montana
SUMMARY: China's foreign ministry described the balloon as "a civilian airship" used for meteorological research that had blown far off course by winds. The Pentagon suspects it's collecting information.

TITLE: 'Who the hell would want this job?' Not NCAA President Mark Emmert, apparently
SUMMARY: NCAA President Mark Emmert is stepping down from his position amid a turbulent time for the organization.

TITLE: A GuantÃ¡namo inmate was released to Belize after suing for wrongful imprisonment
SUMMARY: A 42-year-old Pakistani man who spent nearly half his life in U.S. custody has been released from GuantÃ¡namo and resettled in Belize after suing the Biden administration for unlawful imprisonment.

TITLE: A Portuguese pooch that was almost killed at birth has become the world's oldest dog
SUMMARY: At 30 years and 266 days and counting, Bobi, a purebred Rafeiro do Alentejo, has broken the century-old world record for oldest dog ever, according to Guinness World Records.

TITLE: Remembering Victor Navasky, longtime editor and publisher of 'The Nation'
SUMMARY: The Nation doubled in circulation under Navasky's tenure. He went on to teach at Columbia University, and chaired the Columbia Journalism Review. He died Jan 23. Originally broadcast in 1982.

TITLE: Blinken postpones his Beijing trip after a Chinese balloon is spotted over Montana
SUMMARY: China's foreign ministry described the balloon as "a civilian airship" for meteorological research that had blown far off course by winds. The Pentagon suspects it's collecting sensitive information.

TITLE: This winter's U.S. COVID surge is fading fast, likely thanks to a 'wall' of immunity
SUMMARY: The main reason the surge is ebbing now, pandemic experts suspect, is the significant immunity many people in the U.S. have acquired from prior infections and COVID vaccinations many received.

TITLE: The USDA wants to limit added sugars and sodium in school meals
SUMMARY: The new standards, if implemented, would limit added sugars and sodium and emphasize whole-grain and domestically-produced products.

TITLE: 2 men are arrested in a California shooting that killed 6 people including a baby
SUMMARY: Two gang members were arrested early Friday, one after a gunbattle, and charged in the January massacre of six people including a baby at a home associated with a rival gang, a sheriff said.

TITLE: The new global gold rush
SUMMARY: After decades of being seen as a go-nowhere investment, investors are taking a shine to gold again.

TITLE: Chinese balloon punctures Blinken's plans, leaving U.S.-China ties adrift
SUMMARY: Secretary of State Antony Blinken called off his trip to China after the discovery of a Chinese "surveillance" balloon over the U.S. It's the latest setback in an increasingly fraught relationship.

TITLE: Mexico's president says he won't seek an unconstitutional second term

TITLE: The Yosemite postmaster retires after more than 40 years (and a whole lot of mail)
SUMMARY: John Reynolds started his career in the summer of 1978 as a college student. This week, he said goodbye to the calling of a lifetime.

TITLE: A jury clears Elon Musk of wrongdoing related to 2018 Tesla tweets
SUMMARY: The verdict by the nine jurors was reached after less than two hours of deliberation following a three-week trial and represents a major vindication for Musk.

TITLE: A 6th Memphis police officer has been fired after the beating death of Tyre Nichols
SUMMARY: Preston Hemphill had been suspended as he was investigated for his role in the Jan. 7 arrest of Nichols, who died in a hospital three days later. Five Memphis officers have already been fired.

TITLE: Meteorologists are dutifully tracking the location of the Chinese balloon
SUMMARY: While U.S. and Chinese officials are giving conflicting narratives over the balloon's purpose, it poses no safety threat to civilians. But that hasn't stopped people from tracking its route.

SUMMARY: In the era of primetime coverage, the State of the Union offers a rare opportunity for a president to address â and for members to be seen by â a truly national television audience.

TITLE: Israel's far-right government wants the power to override its Supreme Court
SUMMARY: Despite huge protests, Israel's new far-right government is doubling down on its first major initiative: to weaken the judiciary. Hungary and Poland's far-right did the same when they entered office.

TITLE: Here's why you should make a habit of having more fun
SUMMARY: Happiness can sometimes feel just out of reach. But having more fun? You've got this â and those giggles and playful moments can make a big difference to your health and well-being.

TITLE: The geeks on Wall Street are getting very hopeful about the economy. Are they wrong?
SUMMARY: The markets have rallied this year as investors believe inflation will continue to ease and that the economy will avoid a recession â but it could end in tears.

TITLE: What's a spillover? A spillback? Here are definitions for the vocab of a pandemic
SUMMARY: Since the pandemic was declared in 2020, many perhaps unfamiliar terms have become part of daily conversation. Here's a glossary, from antibodies to zoonosis.

TITLE: Activist Alice Wong reflects on 'The Year of the Tiger' and her hopes for 2023
SUMMARY: In the <em>Year of the Tiger: An Activist's Life

SUMMARY: Records are made to be broken, the saying goes. But how did the kid from Akron chase down what seemed like an unbeatable number?

TITLE: A 50-car freight train derailed in Ohio, causing a big fire and evacuations
SUMMARY: The resulting large fire prompted an evacuation order in a village near the Pennsylvania state line. There was no immediate information about what caused the derailment. No injuries were reported.

TITLE: Poetry finally has its own Grammy category â mostly thanks to J. Ivy, nominee
SUMMARY: Poet J. Ivy is a nominee for the Grammys' Best Spoken Word Poetry Album award â a new category he helped create, after petitioning the Recording Academy.

SUMMARY: NPR investigated a practice called a yo-yo sale and found it's hurting car buyers nationwide, tougher rules can make a difference, and the Federal Trade Commission has a chance to crack down.

TITLE: Iowa Alzheimer's care facility is fined $10,000 after pronouncing a living woman dead

TITLE: Gas stove makers have a pollution solution. They're just not using it

TITLE: Markets are surging as fears about the economy fade. Why the optimists could be wrong
SUMMARY: The markets have rallied this year as investors believe inflation will continue to ease and that the economy will avoid a recession â but it could end in tears.

SUMMARY: The vote cements a shift in the presidential primary calendar that many Democrats have long called for and elevates states with greater diversity and voter access.

SUMMARY: The unexpected deaths are hitting humpbacks and North Atlantic right whales on the East Coast and gray whales on the West Coast â populations that were already under watch.

SUMMARY: Nguyen Thi Thanh was 7 years old in 1968 when she says South Korean marines killed five of her family members and shot her in the stomach.

TITLE: Here's what you can expect Biden to say at tonight's State of the Union address
SUMMARY: President Biden will give Americans a progress report on his four-part Unity Agenda, which he announced at last year's State of the Union address.

TITLE: Harry Whittington, the Texas attorney shot by Cheney during a 2006 hunting trip, dies
SUMMARY: Whittington died at age 95 his home Saturday in Austin. In 2006, he and others were hunting with then Vice President Dick Cheney on a ranch, when Cheney, while aiming for a bird, struck Whittington.

TITLE: In Turkey and Syria, outdated building methods all but assured disaster from a quake
SUMMARY: Structures that were constructed before building codes were updated following a 1999 earthquake in Turkey used lots of concrete and masonry, making them brittle and more vulnerable to collapse.

TITLE: Rescuers work for second day to find quake survivors as death toll surpasses 5,400
SUMMARY: Rescue workers fanned across Turkey and Syria Tuesday in a second day of desperate searches to find survivors from the massive earthquake and aftershocks that had the death toll climbing by the hour.

TITLE: Hispanic dialysis patients are more at risk for staph infections, the CDC says
SUMMARY: Hispanic patients had a 40% higher risk of staph than white patients, a study found, and black patients are more at risk as well. The report outlines steps doctors can take to keep patients safer.

TITLE: She was declared dead, but the funeral home found her breathing
SUMMARY: "This is an awful situation that has caused unnecessary trauma for the impacted resident and her loved ones," the New York attorney general's office told NPR.

TITLE: A newborn was found alive in the rubble after the earthquake in Syria
SUMMARY: Residents digging through a collapsed building discovered a crying infant whose mother appears to have given birth to her while buried underneath the rubble. The mother and other family members died.

TITLE: Former prosecutor says Manhattan DA could have charged Trump with multiple crimes
SUMMARY: Mark Pomerantz spent a year investigating Trump, from the hush-money payment to Stormy Daniels, to countless financial statements that wildly overstated assets. His book is <em>People Vs. Donald Trump.

TITLE: Earthquake death toll tops 7,200 in Turkey and Syria as race for survivors continues
SUMMARY: Rescue workers fanned across Turkey and Syria Tuesday in a second day of desperate searches to find survivors from the massive earthquake and aftershocks that had the death toll climbing by the hour.

TITLE: BeyoncÃ© tour sales are off to a smoother start. What does that mean for Ticketmaster?
SUMMARY: Ticketmaster seems to be feeling pressure and making changes as BeyonceÌ tickets go on sale. While things appear to be running more smoothly so far, an economist says there's still cause for concern.

TITLE: Black caucus sees State of the Union as an important chance to push for police reform
SUMMARY: Members of the Congressional Black Caucus invited families that have lost loved ones at the hands of police to be their guests at the State of the Union.

TITLE: One year later, still no medals in disputed Beijing 2022 Olympic team skating event
SUMMARY: Skaters from Russia won the team event with the U.S. second and Japan third. But then it came to light that Russian Kamila Valieva had given a positive drug test weeks before the Olympics.

TITLE: Gustavo Dudamel's new musical home is the New York Philharmonic
SUMMARY: The New York Philharmonic announced Tuesday afternoon that the charismatic 42-year-old conductor will be taking on the music director designate post at the start of the 2025-26 concert season.

TITLE: A speechwriter's guide to watching tonight's State of the Union address
SUMMARY: The State of The Union serves as a check-in with the President. But what can you learn from reading between the lines?

TITLE: Queen of salsa Celia Cruz will be the first Afro Latina to appear on a U.S. quarter
SUMMARY: Cuban American icon Celia Cruz is being honored along with four other influential American women as part of the American Women Quarters Program.

TITLE: How to make sure your donation will do the most good for earthquake survivors
SUMMARY: In the wake of the disaster, people around the world want to help. Here's advice from experts on how to select a charity.

TITLE: The Pentagon says China declined a phone call in response to the balloon's downing
SUMMARY: In a sign of continued tense relations, the U.S. says China declined the request for a phone call between top defense officials

TITLE: Here's who's on Biden's guest list for the State of the Union
SUMMARY: The invitees include cancer survivors and their families, a veteran and his caregivers, a health care professional from a Navajo reservation, a Holocaust survivor and more.

TITLE: Read President Biden's State of the Union speech
SUMMARY: Read President Biden's State of the Union speech delivered on Feb. 7, 2023, as prepared for delivery.

TITLE: LeBron James breaks the NBA career scoring record, passing Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
SUMMARY: The last time a new name appeared atop the NBA's all-time points rankings was in April 1984. LeBron James was born later that year.

TITLE: Biden calls for passage of a bill to stop 'junk fees' in travel and entertainment
SUMMARY: In his State of the Union speech, President Biden addressed the Junk Fees Prevention Act, which aims to limit the hidden fees and charges that exist in the entertainment and travel industries.

TITLE: Biden makes a pitch to 'finish the job' in his State of the Union address
SUMMARY: President Biden repeated the phrase "Let's finish the job" in his address â a refrain likely to be heard as his unofficial pitch for a second term in office.

TITLE: Memphis officer took and shared photos of bloodied Tyre Nichols, documents show
SUMMARY: The Memphis officer stood over Tyre Nichols and took photographs, which he sent to other officers and a female acquaintance, according to documents released by the Tennessee's police standards panel.

TITLE: Sanders says the choice in the U.S. is 'normal or crazy' in GOP response to Biden
SUMMARY: Arkansas' newly elected governor, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, drew a sharp contrast between Republicans and Democrats, especially with respect to what she called the "left-wing culture war."

TITLE: New York City is lifting its COVID-19 vaccine mandate for municipal employees
SUMMARY: New York City began mandating COVID-19 vaccines for municipal employees in July 2021. The mayor said more than 96% of city employees are vaccinated.

TITLE: 5 takeaways from Biden's State of the Union address
SUMMARY: The president drew a clear distinction with House Republicans, baiting them into several moments of hectoring, while seemingly getting them to agree to not cut Social Security or Medicare.

TITLE: In 2022, Ukraine was a rallying cry in the State of the Union. In 2023, not so much
SUMMARY: Last year the State of Union came six days after Russia invaded Ukraine. Lawmakers waved Ukraine flags and cheered President Biden's stirring call for support. This year, the focus had changed.

TITLE: COVID test kits, treatments and vaccines won't be free to many consumers much longer
SUMMARY: Insurers, employers, taxpayers and other consumers will all be affected as drugmakers move these products to the commercial market in May. How much you'll pay depends on your health insurance.

TITLE: No matter who wins, the first Super Bowl with 2 Black quarterbacks will make history
SUMMARY: With Jalen Hurts under center for the Eagles and Patrick Mahomes helming the Chiefs, Sunday's game will mark a milestone after decades of effort by Black quarterbacks to overcome discrimination.

TITLE: Why the EPA puts a higher value on rich lives lost to climate change
SUMMARY: There is one number that the Environmental Protection Agency relies on to decide which climate policies to pursue. So why does that number assume the lives of richer people are worth more?

TITLE: Search teams try to find Turkey and Syria quake survivors as the death toll climbs
SUMMARY: Rescue workers in Turkey and Syria pushed into a third day of recovery operations on Wednesday as the death toll from this week's massive earthquake reached a grim milestone.

TITLE: At least 9 GOP-led state legislatures want to restrict or criminalize drag shows
SUMMARY: Lawmakers in Tennessee are advancing a bill that would restrict drag show performances in the state. This bill and others like it threaten the LGBTQ community as well as businesses, critics say.

TITLE: EliÃ¡n GonzÃ¡lez nearly became an American. Now, he's poised to become a Cuban lawmaker
SUMMARY: Nearly 23 years after being ripped from a relative's home in Miami, GonzÃ¡lez has been nominated to become a member of the communist country's parliament.

TITLE: Zelenskyy makes a rare visit to the U.K. as Russia's war on Ukraine nears 1 year
SUMMARY: Zelenskyy is holding meetings with Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and giving a speech to lawmakers. He told legislators that Ukraine "will always come out on top of evil."

TITLE: A pigeon named Flamingo is dead after someone dyed it pink
SUMMARY: "We don't know why this bird was dyed pink, although many of our followers have speculated that it was for a gender reveal party," a Wild Bird Fund official told NPR.

TITLE: Romney tells Santos 'you don't belong here' in a tense State of the Union run-in
SUMMARY: Sen. Mitt Romney, R-Utah, said the embattled New York congressman, who faces continued questions about his biography and campaign finances, should've been "sitting in the back row and staying quiet."

TITLE: Kim Jong Un celebrated North Korea's army. Will he also display new weapons?
SUMMARY: His young daughter Kim Ju Ae also attended. Some observers interpret this as Kim's message that nuclear weapons will protect future generations of North Koreans.

TITLE: Search teams race to find quake survivors as the death toll climbs past 11,000
SUMMARY: Rescue workers in Turkey and Syria pushed into a third day of recovery operations on Wednesday as the death toll from this week's massive earthquake reached a grim milestone.

TITLE: How Stokely Carmichael and the Black Panthers changed the civil rights movement
SUMMARY: Journalist Mark Whitaker says that much of what's happening in American race relations today traces back to 1966, the year the Black Panthers were formed. His new book is Saying it Loud.

TITLE: A man jailed in the theft of monkeys from the Dallas zoo said he'd do it again
SUMMARY: Court records say Davion Irvin told police that he jumped a zoo fence after dark, cut the metal mesh of a tamarin monkey enclosure and took the two emperor tamarin monkeys before escaping by train.

TITLE: A South Korean man is sentenced to 40 years in a stalking and murder case
SUMMARY: The man was convicted of killing a female colleague in a Seoul subway station last year, a day before he was to be sentenced on stalking charges. This has led to calls for better protection for women.

TITLE: Malaysian Airlines shootdown probe finds 'strong indications' Putin approved missiles
SUMMARY: Investigators said they found that the Russian president likely approved the supply of heavy anti-aircraft weapons to Ukrainian separatists who shot down flight MH17 in 2014 with a Russian missile.

TITLE: Zoom is the latest tech firm to announce layoffs, and its CEO will take a 98% pay cut
SUMMARY: Zoom, a hallmark of pandemic life, is laying off some 1,300 employees, or about 15% of its workforce. CEO Eric Yuan said he and other executives will take pay cuts and forego bonuses.

TITLE: A look at the impact of delivering aid to Turkey and Syria through Dubai's global hub
SUMMARY: A 1.5 million square-ft. zone of Dubai known as International Humanitarian City is the world's largest aid hub, with warehouses for U.N. agencies, Red Cross and Red Crescent organizations and others.

TITLE: Why Zelenskyy visited the U.K. nearly 1 year into Russia's war on Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Ukrainian president spoke to Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and the Parliament, and made a plea for warplanes.

TITLE: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar reflects on his strained relationship with LeBron James
SUMMARY: In an online letter a day after James broke his scoring record, Abdul-Jabbar blamed himself for the contentious relationship between them, citing his own introversion and a significant age gap.

TITLE: N.Y. Philharmonic chief looks to Gustavo 'Dudamel era' after historic appointment
SUMMARY: New York philharmonic president and CEO Deborah Borda discusses the decisionmaking process behind bringing the superstar conductor to the Big Apple.

TITLE: Woodpeckers went nuts, stashing 700 pounds of acorns in the wall of a California home
SUMMARY: Exterminator Nick Castro found the massive stash of acorns after being called to a home with a worm problem. "Bird was a bit of a hoarder," he joked on social media.

TITLE: Ex-Twitter officials reject GOP claims of government collusion
SUMMARY: At a contentious House committee hearing, Republicans aired long-held grievances over what they say is Silicon Valley's bias against conservatives.

TITLE: Some Fabuloso cleaning products are recalled over possible bacteria contamination
SUMMARY: The recall includes more than 4.9 million bottles produced between Dec. 14 and Jan. 23. The products were sold online and at major retailers.

TITLE: Two new kids in class share their State of the Union first impressions
SUMMARY: They might be new to school, but two freshman congressmen have plenty of insight to offer on Joe Biden's State of the Union address.

TITLE: Residents can return home after crews burned chemicals in derailed tanker cars
SUMMARY: Around-the-clock air monitoring has shown normal, un-concerning levels days after the controlled burn, according to the EPA.

TITLE: If you got inflation relief from your state, the IRS wants you to wait to file taxes
SUMMARY: They're dubbed inflation relief payments, but they reflect a hodgepodge of rules and eligibility requirements. The IRS wants time to figure out which rules apply to them.

TITLE: 4.9 million Fabuloso bottles are recalled over the risk of bacteria contamination
SUMMARY: The products were sold online and at major retailers. As of the recall, no incidents or injuries had been reported.

TITLE: A man pleads guilty to federal charges in the El Paso shooting that targeted Latinos
SUMMARY: Sentencing is not scheduled until later this year, but the U.S. government had previously announced it wouldn't seek the death penalty.

TITLE: Disney's Bob Iger is swinging the ax as he plans to lay off 7,000 workers worldwide
SUMMARY: Returning CEO Bob Iger is making a statement to his board about the company's finances moving forward.

TITLE: Southwest's COO will tell senators 'we messed up' over the holiday travel meltdown
SUMMARY: NPR obtained Chief Operating Officer Andrew Watterson's prepared testimony for his scheduled appearance before a Senate committee to discuss what led to thousands of flights being canceled.

TITLE: Following the U.S., Australia says it will remove Chinese-made surveillance cameras
SUMMARY: Australia will remove surveillance cameras made by Chinese Communist Party-linked companies from its buildings, the government said Thursday after the U.S. and Britain made similar moves.

TITLE: Hopes fade as rescuers press search for quake survivors in Turkey and Syria
SUMMARY: Rescue workers pressed their search Thursday across Turkey and Syria for survivors from this week's massive earthquake and aftershocks as the window to find people alive began to close.

TITLE: Killer whale moms are still supporting their adult sons â and it's costing them
SUMMARY: Orca moms spent precious resources feeding their fully grown adult male offspring. A new study finds that this may limit how many more young they produce.

TITLE: 5 storylines to watch for a Super Bowl between heavyweights: the Chiefs and Eagles
SUMMARY: The Philadelphia Eagles were the league's most complete team this year, but Kansas City had its best offense by far. Plus, look out for a pair of brothers and a historic quarterback matchup.

TITLE: One state looks to get kids in crisis out of the ER â and back home
SUMMARY: At many U.S. hospitals, children and teens are stuck in the emergency department for days or weeks because psychiatric beds are full. Massachussets has a simple, yet promising solution..

TITLE: In Iran, NPR sees anger and desperation. Its government tells us nothing is wrong
SUMMARY: In an interview with NPR in Tehran, Iran's foreign minister dismisses the protests that have spread in the wake of Mahsa Amini's death, saying "nothing important had happened."

TITLE: Twitter's new data access rules will make social media research harder
SUMMARY: Twitter will start charging users for downloading and uploading data. Everything from bots giving out earthquake alerts to ambitious research about how misinformation spreads could be affected.

TITLE: Syrians cheer on extraordinary rescues in the earthquake's dire aftermath
SUMMARY: Hope is fading for finding survivors after Monday's devastating earthquake. But widely shared footage of volunteers pulling people alive from rubble in northwest Syria has lifted spirits.

TITLE: Greta Thunberg's 'The Climate Book' urges world to keep climate justice out front
SUMMARY: Activist Greta Thunberg was just 15 when she called on the world to take action on the climate crisis. Just as impressively, she has now pulled together essays by 100 scholars on what's needed now.

TITLE: Sen. John Fetterman spends the night in the hospital after feeling lightheaded
SUMMARY: The first-term Pennsylvania senator is in good spirits and has been talking with staff and family. He suffered a stroke last year, but initial tests Wednesday didn't show evidence of another stroke.

TITLE: As the earthquake death toll soars, so does criticism of Turkey's government response
SUMMARY: Critics are laying into the government of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, accusing it of incompetence in its response to the massive quake and misplacing tax revenues meant for dealing with disasters.

SUMMARY: The Suns will send Cam Johnson, Mikal Bridges, Jae Crowder, four first-round picks and additional draft compensation to the Nets for Durant, a 13-time All-Star who averages nearly 30 points per game.

TITLE: Nicaragua frees 222 political prisoners to the U.S.
SUMMARY: On state television a judge said the government had decided to "deport" the prisoners, saying they had been declared traitors and can never again serve public office.

TITLE: House panel on 'weaponization' of the federal government will hold its first hearing
SUMMARY: The new subcommittee is part of the House Republican majority's push to ramp up scrutiny of the Biden administration.

TITLE: Google's AI new chatbot made a $100 billion mistake in a demo ad
SUMMARY: Google's Bard, an answer to Microsoft's ChatGPT, delivered a factual error in a search demo that the company shared widely. That sent Alphabet's market value plummeting this week.

TITLE: Take a look at the image people voted to award Wildlife Photographer of the Year
SUMMARY: German photographer Sascha Fonseca set out bait-free camera traps three years ago to capture the ever-elusive snow leopard in the Indian Himalayas.

TITLE: With over 19,000 dead, hopes fade for finding Turkey and Syria quake survivors
SUMMARY: Rescue workers pressed their search Thursday across Turkey and Syria for survivors from this week's massive earthquake and aftershocks as the window to find people alive began to close.

TITLE: Republican State of the Union rebuttals differed in more than just language
SUMMARY: Republican rebuttals to President Biden's speech were not only given in different languages but touched on different GOP priorities and addressed varied concerns to each separate audience.

TITLE: Google's new AI chatbot made a $100 billion mistake in a demo ad
SUMMARY: Google's Bard, an answer to Microsoft's ChatGPT, delivered a factual error in a search demo that the company shared widely. That sent Alphabet's market value plummeting this week.

TITLE: Videos show extraordinary rescues in Syria in the earthquake's dire aftermath
SUMMARY: Hope is fading for finding survivors after Monday's devastating earthquake. But widely shared footage of volunteers pulling people alive from rubble in northwest Syria has lifted spirits.

TITLE: Biden had a sick burn in his State of the Union speech. 'Lots of luck' explaining it
SUMMARY: President Biden wished congressional Republicans "lots of luck in your senior year" during his State of the Union speech â  a taunt that had a lot of people wondering.

TITLE: Plan to collect menstrual data on high school athletes in Florida is voted down
SUMMARY: The Florida High School Athletic Association's board of directors votes to remove questions about athletes' menstrual history from a required health form for participation in school sports.

TITLE: House panel on 'weaponization' of the federal government holds its first hearing
SUMMARY: The new subcommittee is part of the House Republican majority's push to ramp up scrutiny of the Biden administration.

TITLE: Google shares drop $100 billion after its new AI chatbot makes a mistake
SUMMARY: Google's Bard, an answer to Microsoft's ChatGPT, delivered a factual error in a search demo that the company shared widely. That sent Alphabet's market value plummeting this week.

TITLE: Church of England OKs blessings for same-sex couples, but it still won't marry them
SUMMARY: Same-sex couples still can't marry in the church, but clergy can now choose to confer blessings on a civil marriage or partnership. The decision came after a vigorous debate.

TITLE: 'All the Beauty and the Bloodshed' chronicles Nan Goldin's career of art and activism
SUMMARY: Filmmaker Laura Poitras and Goldin discuss their Oscar-nominated documentary about<em>

TITLE: What we know so far about the suspected Chinese spy balloon and FBI probe
SUMMARY: FBI and State Department officials gave reporters an update on some of what the U.S. has learned so far about the balloon.

TITLE: The world's deadliest earthquakes in the past 25 years, at a glance
SUMMARY: The magnitude 7.8 earthquake that struck Turkey and war-torn Syria on Monday has killed more than 20,000 people. Here are some of the world's deadliest earthquakes in the past quarter-century.

SUMMARY: The rules would require drugmakers to rebate Medicare for cost increases that outpace inflation. The drug industry is expected to put up a fight over implementation.

TITLE: Leo DiCaprio's dating history is part of our obsession with staying young forever
SUMMARY: Among age-gap discourse and the increasing fixation on preventing wrinkles, we will still find ourselves getting older no matter what we do.

TITLE: Fans are in disbelief over Kevin Durant's departure from the Brooklyn Nets
SUMMARY: Fans, fellow NBA athletes and the mayor of Phoenix all took to social media to voice their reactions. "That is insane," one fan, Joe Brooks, told NPR. "I can't believe that they actually did it."

TITLE: Charles Silverstein, a psychologist who helped destigmatize homosexuality, dies at 87
SUMMARY: Homosexuality was considered a mental disorder and "sexual deviation" until 1973 â months after Silverstein gave a presentation challenging the classification.

TITLE: Medicare announces plan to recoup billions from drug companies
SUMMARY: Drugmakers will be required to pay Medicare back for price increases that outpace inflation. The industry is expected to put up a fight over implementation.

TITLE: Florida high school athletes won't have to report their periods after emergency vote
SUMMARY: The Florida High School Athletic Association's board of directors has voted to remove questions about athletes' menstrual history from a required health form for participation in school sports.

TITLE: Nicaragua has freed 222 political prisoners and sent them to the U.S.
SUMMARY: On state television a judge said the government had decided to "deport" the prisoners, saying they had been declared traitors and can never again serve public office.

TITLE: House panel on 'weaponization' of the government's first hearing takes aim at DOJ, FBI
SUMMARY: The hours-long meeting for the House Judiciary Committee's select subpanel saw Republicans and Democrats trading attacks.

TITLE: In France, Macron faces calls to rescind Vladimir Putin's Legion of Honor medal
SUMMARY: Some French legislators and activists are calling on the French president to rescind the award to the Russian leader because of the Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: HarperCollins and striking union reach tentative agreement
SUMMARY: HarperCollins Publishers and the union representing around 250 striking employees reached a tentative agreement providing increases to entry-level salaries. A ratified contract would run through 2025.

TITLE: Kaya, a furry ambassador for veterans and service dogs, passes away
SUMMARY: The furry companion lobbied for historic legislation that helps fund service dogs for others struggling with mental health, known as the PAWS Act.

TITLE: As the pandemic ebbs, an influential COVID tracker shuts down
SUMMARY: After three years, the Johns Hopkins Coronavirus Resource Center is ceasing operations. Its data dashboards and maps became go-to sources for information from the early days of the pandemic.

TITLE: Temple University cuts tuition and health benefits for striking graduate students
SUMMARY: Some research and teaching assistants at the Philadelphia school have been striking for better pay since last week. The university is now revoking benefits for students who walk off the job to strike.

TITLE: 6 major takeaways from the ATF's first report in 20 years on U.S. gun crime
SUMMARY: The Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives released a major report that details how stolen guns and emerging technology like "ghost guns" play a factor in gun violence in the U.S.

TITLE: Gender-neutral terms for God are up for discussion, the Church of England says
SUMMARY: "Christians have recognized since ancient times that God is neither male nor female," a spokesperson for the Church of England says.

TITLE: An artist's 'Healing Project,' focused on incarceration and violence, wins $1 million
SUMMARY: Multidisciplinary artist Samora Pinderhughes has explored mass incarceration for the last eight years. With this sizeable grant, he hopes to sustain "The Healing Project" for decades to come.

TITLE: 3 amateur codebreakers set out to decrypt old letters. They uncovered royal history
SUMMARY: Cryptologists found and decoded over 50 long-lost letters that Mary, Queen of Scots wrote during her time in captivity. A historian calls them the most important new findings about her in 100 years.

TITLE: Philly may grease poles ahead of the Super Bowl. Eagles fans don't care
SUMMARY: Philadelphia habitually greases the light poles in Center City to keep jubilant fans earthbound after a big win. Fans sometimes treat these safety measures like a dare.

TITLE: This race is a nonstop sail around the world. Cassette tapes are allowed, but no GPS
SUMMARY: To win the Golden Globe Race, sailors compete solo using celestial navigation to find their way, and they are forced to battle high winds and rough seas without the use of any electronic equipment.

TITLE: Russia is draining a massive Ukrainian reservoir, endangering a nuclear plant
SUMMARY: Satellite data show water levels plummeting at the massive Kakhovka Reservoir. The reservoir supplies drinking water, irrigates vast tracts of farmland, and cools Europe's largest nuclear plant.

TITLE: On the road to healing, tribal citizens are speaking out about boarding schools
SUMMARY: Listening sessions on the Gila and Navajo Nations discuss a path forward for Native survivors of decades of abuse and mistreatment at federal Indian boarding schools.

TITLE: Patrick Mahomes is named the NFL's 2022 Most Valuable Player
SUMMARY: Patrick Mahomes of the Kansas City Chiefs was named the Associated Press 2022 NFL Most Valuable Player, easily outdistancing his Super Bowl rival, the Philadelphia Eagles' Jalen Hurts.

TITLE: Kaya, a furry ambassador for veterans and service dogs, has died
SUMMARY: The furry companion lobbied for historic legislation that helps fund service dogs for others struggling with mental health, known as the PAWS Act.

TITLE: Former NFL players are suing the league over denied disability benefits
SUMMARY: Ten former players are suing the National Football League, claiming its doctors were biased and purposely gave them unfavorable reports so the NFL could justify not paying for disability benefits.

TITLE: Israel says 2 people are dead after a man rammed his car into a group of people
SUMMARY: Officials say a 6-year-old boy and a man in his 20s were killed when a Palestinian driver rammed a car into a group of people at a bus stop in a largely ultra-Orthodox Jewish settlement neighborhood.

TITLE: 3 books in translation that have received acclaim in their original languages
SUMMARY: On a Woman's Madness and Forbidden Notebook have been highly lauded in their original languages for decades but, like the more recent Black Foam

TITLE: Rail workers never stopped fighting for paid sick days. Now persistence is paying off
SUMMARY: The freight railroad CSX announced this week it had made a deal to provide paid sick leave to roughly 5,000 rail workers. The White House and lawmakers are pushing other railroads to follow suit.

TITLE: Rep. Angie Craig told police she fought off an attacker using hot coffee
SUMMARY: Rep. Craig, D-Minn., is bruised but otherwise OK after a man attacked her Thursday. Her suspected assailant, now in custody, did not appear to have political motivations

TITLE: Your Super Bowl platter may cost less this year â if you follow these menu twists
SUMMARY: While supermarket inflation is still high, there are savings to be found on Super Bowl snacks. Prices for chicken wings and guacamole have fallen sharply since last year's big game.

TITLE: Prosecutors will review all cases of the ex-officers charged in Tyre Nichols' death
SUMMARY: The Shelby County District Attorney's Office says it will review all "closed and pending" cases of the five former Memphis police officers charged in Nichols' death. Four had prior violations at work.

TITLE: Brazil's new president is meeting with Biden to talk climate change and democracy
SUMMARY: It was just over a month ago that hundreds of supporters of Brazil's former President Jair Bolsonaro stormed the capital and ransacked the Congress, Supreme Court and the presidential offices.

TITLE: After Martha's Vineyard, lawmakers give DeSantis $10 million more to move migrants
SUMMARY: As Florida dedicates more money to transport migrants from other states, advocates say there isn't enough oversight to make sure transport is done legally and that migrants are relocated voluntarily.

TITLE: U.S. shoots down 'high-altitude object' over Alaska
SUMMARY: It is unclear what the object is but the incident comes just days after the U.S. shot down a Chinese spy balloon off the coast of South Carolina.

TITLE: FBI conducts 'consensual' search on Mike Pence's Indiana home
SUMMARY: Former Vice President Mike Pence's Indiana home is being search with consent from the former vice president's team. This comes after Pence reported classified documents in his possession.

TITLE: Amsterdam will ban cannabis outdoors in its red-light district
SUMMARY: The measure, which is set to go into effect in May, is an attempt to appease residents in the neighborhood, which attracts millions of tourists each year.

TITLE: The U.S. shot down an object over Alaska. The government doesn't know yet what it was
SUMMARY: It is unclear what the object is but the incident comes just days after the U.S. shot down a Chinese spy balloon off the coast of South Carolina.

TITLE: Are there places you should still mask in, forever? Three experts weigh in
SUMMARY: NPR asked COVID-19 experts how we should keep weighing risk as we enter the fourth year of the pandemic.

TITLE: Halyna Hutchins' Ukrainian relatives sue Alec Baldwin over her death on 'Rust' set
SUMMARY: The parents and sister of the slain cinematographer are seeking damages from actor Alec Baldwin in Hutchins' fatal shooting on the movie set. Her widower reached an earlier settlement with Baldwin.

TITLE: As the Sierra Club reckons with its past, a new leader charts a more inclusive future
SUMMARY: After a conflict and reckoning stemming from its controversial past, the Sierra Club had to look inward. Can Ben Jealous bring the organization into the future?

TITLE: Biden and Lula are meeting to discuss Brazil's democracy and climate change
SUMMARY: It was just over a month ago that hundreds of supporters of Brazil's former President Jair Bolsonaro stormed the capital and ransacked the Congress, Supreme Court and the presidential offices.

TITLE: Moldova's government, stressed by war in neighboring Ukraine, undergoes a shakeup
SUMMARY: Moldova's president tapped her defense and security adviser, pro-Western economist Dorin Recean, to succeed the prime minister who resigned 18 months into a tenure tested by Russia's war in Ukraine.

TITLE: Biden and Brazil's Lula find common ground against violent extremism
SUMMARY: It was just over a month ago that hundreds of extremist supporters of former President Jair Bolsonaro, stormed the capital and ransacked the Congress, Supreme Court and the presidential offices.

TITLE: Sen. John Fetterman is discharged from the hospital and will return to work Monday
SUMMARY: Tests ruled out a stroke and found no evidence of a seizure. Fetterman went to the hospital after feeling lightheaded at a Senate Democratic retreat.

TITLE: Nicaragua sentences Catholic bishop to 26 years in prison
SUMMARY: Catholic Bishop Rolando Alvarez refused to leave Nicaragua with other political prisoners released on Thursday.

TITLE: The IRS now says most state relief checks last year are not subject to federal taxes
SUMMARY: A week after telling payment recipients to delay filing returns, the agency won't challenge the taxability of payments related to general welfare and disaster.

TITLE: After Turkey's quake, some people left homeless say they haven't eaten in days
SUMMARY: In a camp in Gaziantep and in makeshift settlements in the fields around it, survivors of Monday's quake say they do not have enough food, water, heating or basic amenities to keep themselves alive.

TITLE: Republicans say they won't cut Social Security. So why does it keep coming up?
SUMMARY: Republicans committed publicly at the State of the Union not to cut Social Security or Medicare. But it remains the party's third rail amid talks over the debt ceiling.

TITLE: Even a cemetery in France is affected by Putin's war
SUMMARY: The largest Russian Orthodox cemetery outside Russia is in a suburb of Paris. This normally tranquil place has become a battleground between Russia and the West.

TITLE: The U.S. needs more affordable housing â where to put it is a bigger battle
SUMMARY: American suburbs mandated single-family homes generations ago, often to segregate areas by race and class. New laws allow more-affordable options like townhomes but construction so far has been slow.

TITLE: ERs staffed by private equity firms aim to cut costs by hiring fewer doctors
SUMMARY: Increasingly, private equity firms shape staffing decisions at hospital emergency rooms, research shows. One apparent effect: Hiring fewer doctors and more health care practitioners who earn far less.

TITLE: Antisemitic text was projected onto the Anne Frank House in Amsterdam
SUMMARY: A display alluding to an antisemitic conspiracy theory was projected onto the former hiding place of Anne Frank, a Jewish girl whose diary notes the persecution her people faced during World War II.

SUMMARY: Here's everything you need to know about Super Bowl LVII, with some help from our member stations KCUR in Kansas City and WHYY in Philadelphia.

TITLE: Northern Syria, already ravaged by war, is unable to receive aid after the earthquake
SUMMARY: In northern Syria, people already displaced by civil war are now suffering from the effects of this week's earthquake. But aid has been unable to reach them.

TITLE: Survivors are still being found as the earthquake's death toll tops 25,000
SUMMARY: Rescue crews pulled more survivors, including entire families, from toppled buildings despite diminishing hopes as the death toll of the quake in Turkey and Syria surpassed 25,000.

TITLE: The Pence subpoena could set up a showdown over executive privilege
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump has repeatedly invoked executive privilege as attempts to block testimony about the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol.

TITLE: An uncrewed Russian spacecraft docked at the space station loses cabin pressure
SUMMARY: The incident does not pose a danger to the station's crew, Russian space officials said. The announcement came shortly after a new Russian cargo ship docked at the station.

TITLE: Northern Syria, already ravaged by war, is desperate for aid after the earthquake
SUMMARY: In northern Syria, people already displaced by civil war are now suffering from the effects of this week's earthquake. But aid has been unable to reach them.

SUMMARY: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said he ordered the take-down after the object violated Canada's airspace.

SUMMARY: The Maryland Democrat, who is in treatment for cancer, credited the musician for inspiring him to wear bandanas while he undergoes chemotherapy.

SUMMARY: Rescue crews pulled more survivors, including entire families, from toppled buildings despite diminishing hopes as the death toll of the quake in Turkey and Syria surpassed 28,000.

SUMMARY: As rescuers still pulled some from the rubble, Turkish officials detained or issued warrants for those allegedly involved in constructing buildings that toppled down and crushed their occupants.

SUMMARY: For years, chocolate-lovers have pointed to studies suggesting compounds in cocoa may be good for heart health. But some of the recent evidence comes from flavanol-rich cocoa, not from candy bars

TITLE: Fireworks and 'Death to the dictator': Iranians assess the Revolution, 44 years on
SUMMARY: Following protests and crackdowns over the past five months, authorities held events to mark the 1979 Revolution this week. They show Iranians have mixed feelings about their nation.

TITLE: An uncrewed Russian spacecraft docked at the space station loses pressure
SUMMARY: The incident does not pose a danger to the station's crew, Russian space officials said. The announcement came shortly after a new Russian cargo ship docked at the station.

TITLE: Black farmers call for justice from the USDA
SUMMARY: Decades after a major lawsuit against the USDA, Black farmers still face inequality.

TITLE: Turkey detains building contractors as the quake death toll rises to more than 33,000
SUMMARY: As rescuers still pulled some from the rubble, Turkish officials detained those allegedly involved in constructing buildings that toppled down and crushed their occupants.

TITLE: The College Board slams Florida for what it calls 'slander' of AP Black history course
SUMMARY: Florida officials claimed the new AP African American Studies  course has a "political agenda," but the education nonprofit says state leaders never made any concrete suggestions on how to change it.

TITLE: Over Lake Huron, the U.S. downs a 3rd unidentified object in 3 days
SUMMARY: A unidentified object has been shot down by U.S. forces over Michigan's Lake Huron, according to politicians from the state. It's the fourth aerial shootdown in just over a week in North America.

SUMMARY: Chiefs quarterback and NFL MVP Patrick Mahomes led the Chiefs to their third Super Bowl victory (and second in three years). It's the first time the reigning MVP has won a Super Bowl since 1999.

SUMMARY: People buried under rubble in southern Turkey continue to defy the odds, surviving freezing weather and a week without water. A 40-year-old woman was pulled alive in Gaziantep province early Monday.

SUMMARY: Federal workplace safety authorities have fined a central Pennsylvania confectionary factory more than $14,500 following an accident last year in which two workers fell into a vat of chocolate.

TITLE: The Philippines accuses a Chinese ship of aiming a laser at a Filipino boat crew
SUMMARY: The Philippines has accused a Chinese coast guard ship of hitting a Philippine coast guard vessel with a military-grade laser and temporarily blinding some of its crew in the disputed South China Sea.

TITLE: 3 men in 3 days fell through the ice over a lake in Vermont
SUMMARY: The three men were all ice fishermen, and two of the men were brothers.

TITLE: Reporter's dismissal exposes political pressures on West Virginia Public Broadcasting
SUMMARY: A reporter was dismissed after state officials complained â the latest instance of political pressure on the station from Gov. Jim Justice's administration and some state legislators.

TITLE: Adidas is looking to repurpose unsold Yeezy products. Here are some of its options
SUMMARY: Retail experts say Yeezys will be particularly difficult to resell given their distinct design and damaged reputation. But not doing so could cost Adidas up to 500 million euros.

TITLE: If there's a war against climate change, Saint-Louis is on the front line. And losing
SUMMARY: The UNESCO World Heritage city of Saint-Louis is perched precariously between the Atlantic Ocean and the Senegal River. And it's on borrowed time.

TITLE: 'Hijab Butch Blues' challenges stereotypes and upholds activist self-care
SUMMARY: Lamya H's memoir is a study guide on Islam and a queer manifesto that follows them from a childhood a move to the U.S. through questions of faith, gender and sexuality.

TITLE: 3 men in 3 days die after falling through ice on Vermont's Lake Champlain
SUMMARY: The three men were all ice fishermen, and two of the men were brothers.

TITLE: Super Bowl commercials, from Adam Driver(s) to M&M candies; the hits and the misses
SUMMARY: Advertisers spent up to $7 million for every 30 seconds of airtime during Super Bowl LVII. Here's a sampling of what worked â and didn't â in the most expensive ad showcase on American television.

TITLE: China accuses U.S. of flying spy balloons into Chinese airspace more than 10 times
SUMMARY: The accusations made by China on Monday have further ratcheted up tensions between the two countries amid mutual allegations of surveillance.

TITLE: A judge blocks the release of most of a grand jury report in Georgia election probe
SUMMARY: For now, the final recommendations of a special grand jury investigating attempts to overturn Georgia's 2020 presidential election will largely be kept under wraps, a judge ruled.

TITLE: The U.S. is urging Americans to leave Russia 'immediately' due to security risks
SUMMARY: The embassy in Moscow warned of the "unpredictable consequences" of the war in Ukraine, and said dual U.S.-Russian citizens in particular risked being forcibly conscripted into Russia's armed forces.

TITLE: 'Dr. Lisa on the street' busts health myths and empowers patients
SUMMARY: She's seen what happens when people don't trust or understand their doctor. Dr. Lisa Fitzpatrick founded 'Grapevine Health' to get solid information out, especially to Black and Latinx patients.

TITLE: Latest in Ukraine: Updates on Russia's war and a look ahead (Feb. 13)
SUMMARY: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: Haley signals a new direction for the GOP's national ticket
SUMMARY: Vice President Kamala Harris' ascent to her current position represents a long step toward making women's full political equality a reality in both parties.

TITLE: Videos show Turkey's Erdogan boasted letting builders avoid earthquake codes
SUMMARY: Videos have surfaced in Turkish media of the president in 2019 praising a policy that let builders off the hook for skirting safety codes that could have made buildings more quake resistant.

TITLE: UFOs? Airborne objects? What we know about 4 recent shootdowns
SUMMARY: The shootdowns came in steady succession over the weekend, after alarms were raised in early February over an object spotted over Montana.

TITLE: They can shoot down the UFOs, but they can't shoot down our hopes of meeting aliens
SUMMARY: We've been seeing a lot of unexplained UFOs lately. Now the White House has stepped in to set the record straight.

TITLE: 'Dr. Lisa on the Street' busts health myths and empowers patients
SUMMARY: She's seen what happens when people don't trust or understand their doctor. Dr. Lisa Fitzpatrick founded 'Grapevine Health' to get solid information out, especially to Black and Latinx patients.

TITLE: A bullied N.J. student died by suicide. Now, the superintendent has resigned
SUMMARY: Adriana Kuch, a freshman in the Central Regional School District along the Jersey Shore, died on Feb. 3. Her father says bullying led her to take her own life.

TITLE: Biden fires the Architect of the Capitol after bipartisan criticism from lawmakers
SUMMARY: An inspector general investigation found that J. Brett Blanton had misused government vehicles and "impersonated a government agent," among other ethical violations.

TITLE: Multiple people are injured in a shooting at Michigan State University, police say
SUMMARY: Police say shootings have been reported in multiple locations and say there is one suspect.

TITLE: 3 people have died in shootings at Michigan State University, police say
SUMMARY: Police said they are searching for one suspect tied to the shootings that took place at multiple locations on the Michigan State campus.

TITLE: 3 people killed at Michigan State University and the gunman is dead, police say
SUMMARY: Police say the suspect was found off the MSU campus and had died from what appeared to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

TITLE: 3 people are killed at Michigan State University and the gunman is dead, police say
SUMMARY: Police say the suspect was a 43-year-old man found off the MSU campus and had died from what appeared to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

TITLE: After Turkey's quake, one family mourns its losses â and braces for more
SUMMARY: As volunteers continue digging through the rubble of a collapsed apartment building, the siblings of a woman found dead with her four children are now awaiting news of their mother and another sister.

SUMMARY: Greta Thunberg says she has no plans to get into politics as a career, and she thinks she can do more as a climate campaigner on the outside.

TITLE: Lasers, robots, and tiny electrodes are transforming treatment of severe epilepsy
SUMMARY: For people with drug-resistant epilepsy, surgery used to be seen as a last resort. Now it's often the treatment of choice.

TITLE: More than half of Republicans support Christian nationalism according to a new survey
SUMMARY: Christian nationalism has been seen as outside the mainstream. But new data from the Public Religion Research Institute and the Brookings Institute indicates it's more common than many think.

TITLE: Nearly $50,000 a week for a cancer drug? A man worries about bankrupting his family
SUMMARY: Medicare suddenly stopped paying for the pricey drug that prolongs his life. As he waits for an appeal, this retired physician wonders if he should give up treatment to spare his family the cost.

TITLE: Health concerns grow in East Palestine, Ohio, after train derailment
SUMMARY: Air monitoring continues in East Palestine after the crews released a number of toxic chemicals in what officials called a "controlled explosion" last week.

TITLE: He was the head of Mexico's FBI. Now he's on trial for accepting cartel bribes
SUMMARY: Guilty or innocent, the drug-corruption trial in New York of  high-ranking former Mexican government official, Genaro Garcia Luna, shows the limits of the U.S. to win its decades-long "war on drugs."

SUMMARY: A two-part BBC documentary examined Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's role in anti-Muslim raids that killed hundreds in his home state of Gujarat in 2002.

TITLE: Despite Khamenei's amnesty, most protesters in Iran won't go free, advocate says
SUMMARY: Iran has jailed up to 20,000 people in months of protests against the regime. The announcement that it's pardoning prisoners is an empty gesture, a human rights lawyer says.

TITLE: High-paying jobs that don't need a college degree? Thousands of them are sitting empty
SUMMARY: Trade jobs that require less education, at much lower cost, sit empty. But many parents remain wary of programs that don't lead to a four-year degree.

TITLE: Inflation eased again in January â but there's a cautionary sign
SUMMARY: Annual inflation cooled in January for the seventh month in a row. But price increases accelerated between December and January, fueled by rising shelter, food and gasoline prices.

TITLE: Indian tax authorities raid the BBC weeks after it aired critical Modi documentary
SUMMARY: A two-part BBC documentary examined Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's role in anti-Muslim raids that killed hundreds in his home state of Gujarat in 2002.

TITLE: More than half of Republicans support Christian nationalism, according to a new survey
SUMMARY: Christian nationalism has been seen as outside the mainstream. But new data from the Public Religion Research Institute and the Brookings Institute indicates it's more common than many think.

TITLE: 3 students and a suspect are dead after Michigan State University shooting
SUMMARY: Police say the suspect, a 43-year-old man, was found off the MSU campus and died from what appeared to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. Five others, all students, are in critical condition.

TITLE: As its ambitions soar, Air India orders 470 Boeing and Airbus aircraft
SUMMARY: India's second-largest domestic carrier placed orders for 220 Boeing aircraft valued at $34 billion and 250 Airbus planes in a separate deal that could be worth tens of billions of dollars.
